lead_paragraph: From Mary Williams Walsh at Economix:
snippet: Taxpayers have an unusual reason to watch stock prices this fall. The Treasury is in the process of selling its stakes in three of the companies that it spent the most money bailing out in 2008 and 2009, and much will depend on how those stocks...
abstract: Taxpayers have an unusual reason to watch stock prices this fall. The Treasury is in the process of selling its stakes in three of the companies that it spent the most money bailing out in 2008 and 2009, and much will depend on how those stocks perform in coming months.
